name: SoCap Jam
description: A wild improv show where anyone can throw their name in the bucket and jump into a scene with the city's top improvisers, no experience required! Whether you're brand new or just feeling bold, anything can happen when your name gets called. Special guests this week - Taylor Efford, Zohaib Khan and Yitzi Gal.

name: Estonian Music Week 2025: Launch Party
description:
Kick off the 5th edition of Estonian Music Week festival with glitz and glamour.
Mix and mingle with your friends and fellow community members, VIP guests as you enjoy appetizers and an open bar. Say hello to the artists and get a taste of the festival programming all set against the backdrop of the magnificent ROM.

This event is part of the Estonian Music Week (EMW) festival programme running May 22-25. With performances from folktronica to contemporary classical music, EMW is sure to become your new favourite early-summer music festival.

name: Mykonos Paint Night Workshop
description: Paint a little slice of Greece featuring a charming blue door with the ocean just beyond. It's the perfect way to unwind, get creative, and feel like you've taken a mini escape - no passport or experience needed.

name: Casino Night Fundraiser
description:
A perfect mix of philanthropy and fun! A speak-easy-themed night of action, glamour, gambling, raffles, food & entertainment. Funds raised from the evening help us create more adventures for all kids at Camp. 

This event has become one of the most anticipated annual fundraising events as our community, corporate partners and industry executives Go all in for a great cause. Bustling with casino games including blackjack, craps and roulette, guests enjoy Vegas-style game play.

organizer.name: Variety â€“ the Children's Charity of Ontario & Variety Village

name: Clay Sculpting Workshop
description: Treat yourself to this therapeutic experience. Learn how to create a piece of art unique to you. No experience needed.

name: North York Farmers' Market
description: Celebrating 31 years at Mel Lastman Square this season! We welcome your tried and true Farm and Artisanal Vendor favourites, sprinkled with a few new, excitingly delicious, grab and go options for lunch or dinner. Let's eat, drink, and make merry while celebrating the diversity and richness of our local and regional blessings. We look forward to meeting, and thank you for your support!

name: Ian Maskin - Beyond Neoclassical

location.name: 918 Bathurst Centre for Culture, Media and Education

description:
Immerse yourself in the deep, soothing and healing vibrations of the cello with world acclaimed cellist, composer, and multilingual vocalist Ian Maksin! 

In this concert, he will perform brand new original instrumental music inspired by his recent travels to India and Nepal, as well as music written throughout the years and recorded on several releases: Zaria, Sempre, Alchemist, Amor Renatus. He will also share several songs from his collection of songs from over 50 countries in 38 languages. Maksin's original music transcends well beyond New Age and Neo-Classical, as it encompasses elements of many genres.

name: Blank-281: The Ultimate Blink-182 Experience
description:
Blink-182 fans, are you ready for a night of pure nostalgia? We are proud to present to you the ultimate Blink-182 experience with top-rated cover band Blank-281's I Miss You Tour. Hailing from Atlanta, cover band has had the honor of participating in Jimmy Fallon's Battle Of The Cover Bands on E!.

For the first time ever they are making their way over to Canada to present the fine folks of Petawawa, Toronto, Chatham, Halifax and Sydney with a show that promises to be nothing short of phenomenal. The boys will be doing their renditions of all of your Blink-182 favourites from Rock Show to What's My Age Again. Don't miss your chance to sing along with this award-winning cover band. 

Hosted by Ed the Sock of Much Music.

name: Identity: Live at the El Mocambo
description: Against the Grain Theatre's Identity is a new song cycle created by Juno Award-winning composer Dinuk Wijeratne, and celebrated poet Shauntay Grant. Identity combines jazz and western classical traditions with personal narratives, exploring how we choose to define ourselves. Performed by Grammy Award-winning Baritone Elliot Madore and directed by AtG's Founding Artistic Director Joel Ivany, this world premiere expands upon AtG's original 2022 Identity film project with new songs and staging.

name: Glow in the Dark Paint Pouring Workshop
description: Stimulate your senses as you play with glowing colours in our black light art studio. With this satisfying art technique, let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way. Embrace unpredictable patterns and create a piece of art as unique as a fingerprint. No experience needed!

name: Dimensions Gallery Presents - WANGDERFUL - The Art Of Drag Photography
description:
You're invited to a night where art meets fabulousness!

Featuring the stunning Minhi Wang, a top four finalist from Canada's Drag Race. The exhibition showcases four distinct photographic perspectives ranging from editorial fashion to documentary storytelling. 

Dive into a world where every click captures the magic of transformation and the bold spirit of self-expression. Don't miss this unique celebration of creativity!

name: Wednesday Night Estonian Music Week Jam Kickoff
description: A jam and dance party to kick off Estonian Music Week, hosted by Toronto's premiere Estonian folk fusion band, Hypnosis Negative. The jam is open to all instruments, and will star some of the performers from this year's Estonian Music Week - we'll play a lot of traditional Estonian music, but fiddle tunes and folk songs from everywhere are welcome! If you don't play an instrument there will be a bunch of folk dancing that is so easy to jump in on, and traditional call-and-response songs that will carry us deep into the night.

name: Doors Open Toronto Keynote & Free Public Skate
description:
In this keynote event, moderated by Historian Adam Bunch, a panel of experts in the history and culture of Toronto sports will explore those fascinating stories and the ways they've shaped the city's identity â€” for better and for worse. Toronto has been deeply shaped by the sports played here, by the stories of its athletes and its teams. These dramatic events have played out in front of huge crowds and been followed by generations of fans, profoundly influencing the way Torontonians see themselves and their city. 

Come a little early with your skates to take advantage of Mattamy Athletic Centre's indoor ice rink - and skate in the same space that historic Toronto sports legends have made history.
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Keynote_Sports and the Making of Toronto_credit redtea_small_-MWUHHQJ0AC3s0WsLLAPuw.jpg
